Crashing Blades.flavor: You bring both of your weapons crashing down on your foe’s head so hard that it has difficulty focusing for a moment
Crashing Blades.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons
Crashing Blades.effect: Make a secondary attack against the target
Crashing Blades.secondaryOnHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage. If the primary attack also hit, the target is dazed until the end of your next turn

Seeking Roots.name: Seeking Roots
Seeking Roots.flavor: One of your blades finds your foe, then your other one does so. You cap the attacks by scissoring the foe with both weapons
Seeking Roots.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons
Seeking Roots.effect: Make a secondary attack against the target
Seeking Roots.secondaryOnHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage. If the primary attack also hit, the target takes 5 + your Strength modifier extra damage

Predatory Charge.name: Predatory Charge
Predatory Charge.flavor: You lunge toward your foe, while your beast companion leaps on an enemy in your wake.
Predatory Charge.prerequisite: You must be trained in Athletics.
Predatory Charge.requirement: You must charge the primary target and use this power in place of a melee basic attack.
Predatory Charge.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you push the target 1 square and shift into the square it formerly occupied.
Predatory Charge.effect: Your beast companion charges an enemy, and the enemy falls prone on a hit. If that enemy attacked you with an opportunity attack during your turn, your beast companion gains a power bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier to the attack rolls and damage rolls on the secondary attack.

Strength of Earth.name: Strength of Earth
Strength of Earth.flavor: With a mighty heave, you leap into the air and wrap your arms about your foe, dragging it with you to the unyielding earth.
Strength of Earth.prerequisite: You must be trained in Athletics.
Strength of Earth.effect: You jump 3 squares vertically and 5 squares horizontally before making the attack. You can make the following attack at any point during the jump.
Strength of Earth.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.

Thunderfury Charge.name: Thunderfury Charge
Thunderfury Charge.flavor: You slip past your enemies, who are then overwhelmed by your beast companion.
Thunderfury Charge.prerequisite: You must be trained in Athletics.
Thunderfury Charge.requirement: You must begin with your beast companion adjacent to you. You charge a target and use the following attack in place of a melee basic attack. Your movement during this charge does not provoke opportunity attacks.
Thunderfury Charge.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you push the target 1 square and shift into the space it formerly occupied.
Thunderfury Charge.effect: Your beast companion shifts its speed to a space adjacent to you and makes the following secondary attack during its movement.
Thunderfury Charge.secondaryTarget: Each creature to which you moved adjacent during your charge
Thunderfury Charge.secondaryOnHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target falls prone.

Fading Strike.name: Fading Strike
Fading Strike.flavor: You launch an attack against your foe and then back away for safety.
Fading Strike.onHit:
1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and you shift 2 squares to a square that is not adjacent to the target.
Level 21: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
Fading Strike.hunterFightingStyle: When making an opportunity attack, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Marauder's Rush.name: Marauder's Rush
Marauder's Rush.flavor: You rush forward, trusting instinct to guide your attack.
Marauder's Rush.onHit:
1[W] + Strength modifier + Wisdom modifier damage.
Level 21: 2[W] + Strength modifier + Wisdom modifier damage.
Marauder's Rush.special: When charging, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Throw and Stab.name: Throw and Stab
Throw and Stab.flavor: You fling a weapon at one foe and then charge another enemy.
Throw and Stab.requirement: You must be wielding both a thrown weapon and a melee weapon.
Throw and Stab.effect: You move up to your speed and make a melee basic attack against a creature other than the target.

Feral Ambush.name: Feral Ambush
Feral Ambush.flavor: You distract an enemy while your beast lunges for the creature and savages it.
Feral Ambush.onHit: 1[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage. If you and your beast companion are flanking the target, the attack deals 1[B] extra damage.
Feral Ambush.beast: If your companion is a cat, a raptor, a serpent, or a wolf, the attack deals extra damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Hunter's Pounce.name: Hunter's Pounce
Hunter's Pounce.flavor: You leap forward and strike with a single, well-aimed blow. The strike cuts deep and leaves your enemy reeling.
Hunter's Pounce.effect: Before the attack, you shift 2 squares.
Hunter's Pounce.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Hurling Charge.name: Hurling Charge
Hurling Charge.flavor: You hurl one of your weapons and then launch into a charge.
Hurling Charge.requirement: You must be wielding both a thrown weapon and a melee weapon.

Precise Assault.name: Precise Assault
Precise Assault.flavor: You see an opening in an enemy’s defense, and you break off your current attack to take advantage of the weakness.
Precise Assault.effect: Before the attack, you move your speed. You don’t provoke opportunity attacks for leaving a square at the start of this movement.

Skirmish Shot.name: Skirmish Shot
Skirmish Shot.flavor: You rush across the battlefield and then let off a devastating shot.
Skirmish Shot.effect: Before the attack, you move your speed.

Commanding Confrontation.name: Commanding Confrontation
Commanding Confrontation.flavor: You launch an agonizing shot that continues to inhibit your foe with each subsequent attack you make.
Commanding Confrontation.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Commanding Confrontation.effect: Until the target is no longer your quarry, your melee attacks against it deal extra damage equal to 2 + your Wisdom modifier.

Distracting Team.name: Distracting Team
Distracting Team.flavor: You distract your foe while your beast companion moves in for the kill.
Distracting Team.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage. If this hit reduces the target to 0 hit points, this power is not expended.
Distracting Team.effect: Your beast companion moves its speed and makes a secondary attack against the target.
Distracting Team.secondaryOnHit: 2[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage, and your beast companion knocks the target prone.

Isolation Strike.name: Isolation Strike
Isolation Strike.flavor: Your flurry of attacks knocks your opponents back, allowing you to focus on a single foe.
Isolation Strike.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage. If the target is not your quarry, you can push it a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Scything Blow.name: Scything Blow
Scything Blow.flavor: You lash out with your weapon in a wide arc, knocking two foes to the ground. You then drive your blade into them.
Scything Blow.effect: Make a secondary attack against each target.
Scything Blow.onHit: 1[W] damage, and you knock the target prone.

Skirmishing Stance.name: Skirmishing Stance
Skirmishing Stance.flavor: You adopt a defensive, highly mobile combat stance. Your speed helps you catch opponents unprepared and inflict greater damage.
Skirmishing Stance.effect: Until the stance ends, whenever you move at least 4 squares away from where you started your turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Reflex until the start of your next turn, and your next attack before the end of your next turn deals 1d8 extra damage.

Begin the Hunt.name: Begin the Hunt
Begin the Hunt.flavor: You quickly identify your prey and ready yourself to attack it.
Begin the Hunt.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to the initiative check, and using your Hunter’s Quarry, you designate one creature you can see as your quarry. You gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against that creature until it is no longer your quarry.

Invigorating Stride.name: Invigorating Stride
Invigorating Stride.flavor: You back away from danger and catch your breath.
Invigorating Stride.effect: You shift a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier and must not end the shift adjacent to any enemy. You can use your second wind.

Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
Terrain Advantage.flavor: You use the terrain around you as your first line of defense.
Terrain Advantage.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses while you occupy a square of difficult terrain.

Avenging Charge.name: Avenging Charge
Avenging Charge.flavor: You take advantage of an enemy’s opening while it focuses on your ally.
Avenging Charge.effect: You charge the triggering enemy and make the following attack in place of a melee basic attack.

Encircle the Prey.name: Encircle the Prey
Encircle the Prey.flavor: You lure your enemy into position. Then, your beast companion lunges.
Encircle the Prey.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you slide the target 1 square. You can shift 1 square.
Encircle the Prey.effect: Your beast companion makes a melee basic attack against the target as a free action.

Parting Strike.name: Parting Strike
Parting Strike.flavor: You slash your enemy across the legs and then withdraw, leaving your foe hobbled.
Parting Strike.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Parting Strike.effect: After the attack, you shift your speed.

Stalking Strike.name: Stalking Strike
Stalking Strike.flavor: You strike quickly and then disappear, leaving your foe searching for the source of the attack.
Stalking Strike.attack: Dexterity vs. AC. If you are hidden when you attack, you can make a Stealth check to remain hidden if you have any cover or any concealment.

Sustaining Strike.name: Sustaining Strike
Sustaining Strike.flavor: If your first attack fells your enemy, you retain your strength for a future attack.
Sustaining Strike.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Sustaining Strike.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage. If this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, this power is not expended, and you gain a +2 power bonus to the next attack roll you make with this power before the end of the encounter.
Sustaining Strike.effect: Make a secondary attack against the target.

Upending Throw.name: Upending Throw
Upending Throw.flavor: Your muscles strain as you unleash a mighty ranged attack that knocks your foe down.
Upending Throw.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Upending Throw.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.

Bloody Throw.name: Bloody Throw
Bloody Throw.flavor: You drive your weapons into a nearby enemy and then hurl a weapon into the face of another foe.
Bloody Throw.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon in your off hand and a melee weapon in your main hand.
Bloody Throw.effect: Make a secondary attack against the primary target.
Bloody Throw.secondaryOnHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the tertiary target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Bloody Throw.secondaryeffect: Make a ranged tertiary attack. This attack does not provoke opportunity attacks.
Bloody Throw.tertiaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Bloody Throw.secondaryOnMiss: You do not expend this power.

Coordinated Charge.name: Coordinated Charge
Coordinated Charge.flavor: With a silent gesture, you signal your beast, and you both go charging into the fray.
Coordinated Charge.effect: Using your Hunter’s Quarry, you designate the target as your quarry. You and your beast companion charge the target. You can make the following attack in place of a melee basic attack.

Hunter's Confrontation.name: Hunter's Confrontation
Hunter's Confrontation.flavor: Each of your attacks tests your foes’ defenses until you find where to hit to make it count.
Hunter's Confrontation.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Hunter's Confrontation.effect: Until the target is no longer your quarry, whenever you hit the target with a melee attack, you knock it prone.

Snarling Wolf Stance.name: Snarling Wolf Stance
Snarling Wolf Stance.flavor: Like an animal backed into a corner, you become deadlier in your desperation.
Snarling Wolf Stance.effect: Until the stance ends, whenever an enemy hits or misses you with a close or a melee attack, you can make a melee basic attack against it as an immediate reaction. You can then shift 3 squares but must not end the shift adjacent to any enemy.

Tracing Shot.name: Tracing Shot
Tracing Shot.flavor: You hit your foe in a weak spot and use that wound to guide your subsequent attacks.
Tracing Shot.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a power bonus to melee damage rolls against the target equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Wounded Beast.name: Wounded Beast
Wounded Beast.flavor: You answer an enemy’s strike with a snarl and an attack. The rage inside you provides new vigor.
Wounded Beast.effect: You can spend a healing surge.
Wounded Beast.special: You can use this power as an immediate reaction when an enemy adjacent to you bloodies you or scores a critical hit against you.

Clever Teamwork.name: Clever Teamwork
Clever Teamwork.flavor: You maneuver around your enemies, thanks to your collaboration with your allies.
Clever Teamwork.target: You and one ally in the burst
Clever Teamwork.effect: Each target shifts 1 square as a free action.
Clever Teamwork.beast: If your beast companion is a target, add your Wisdom modifier to the number of squares it can shift.

Healing Herbs.name: Healing Herbs
Healing Herbs.flavor: You aid a wounded companion by quickly applying a poultice of healing herbs.
Healing Herbs.effect: You make a Heal check. The target regains hit points equal to half the result of your check. The target can make a saving throw against one poison effect on him or her that a save can end.

Off-Hand Defense.name: Off-Hand Defense
Off-Hand Defense.flavor: You keep your off-hand weapon ready to block enemy attacks.
Off-Hand Defense.effect: Until the stance ends, you gain a +1 power bonus to AC while you are conscious and wielding two melee weapons. If you do not make an off-hand attack during your turn, the bonus is instead +2 until the start of your next turn.

Stealthy Escape.name: Stealthy Escape
Stealthy Escape.flavor: You slip into the shadows, too smoothly for anyone to notice.
Stealthy Escape.prerequisite: You must be trained in Stealth.
Stealthy Escape.trigger: You make a Stealth check and dislike the result
Stealthy Escape.effect: Reroll the Stealth check with a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier. You can use the higher of the two rolls. If the second result is lower than the first, you do not expend this power.

Assess and Strike.name: Assess and Strike
Assess and Strike.flavor: A brush with your off-hand weapon marks a spot on your enemy for a more accurate thrust from your main weapon.
Assess and Strike.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Assess and Strike.onHit: 1[W] damage. Make a secondary attack against the target. You ignore any attack roll penalties to the secondary attack.

Fetch.name: Fetch
Fetch.flavor: After your weapon strikes a foe, your beast grabs the creature and drags it away.
Fetch.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Fetch.target: One creature adjacent to your beast companion
Fetch.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and your beast companion makes a secondary attack against the target.
Fetch.secondaryOnHit: Your beast companion shifts a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier and pulls the target adjacent to it.

Finishing Cut.name: Finishing Cut
Finishing Cut.flavor: You execute a swift attack against a foe, attempting to finish off the creature.
Finishing Cut.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. If the target is bloodied or prone, the attack deals 2[W] extra damage.

Surprising Throw.name: Surprising Throw
Surprising Throw.flavor: You launch your weapon at your foe while your ally distracts it.
Surprising Throw.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Surprising Throw.attack: Strength vs. AC (thrown weapon). The target grants combat advantage to you if it is adjacent to an ally of yours who can take free actions.

Toppling Rush.name: Toppling Rush
Toppling Rush.flavor: You dart forward and slash at your foe’s legs, unbalancing the creature.
Toppling Rush.effect: Before the attack, you move your speed.
Toppling Rush.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.

Bounding Beast.name: Bounding Beast
Bounding Beast.flavor: Your beast pushes back one foe and then charges forth.
Bounding Beast.onHit: 2[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage, and your beast companion pushes the target 1 square.
Bounding Beast.effect: Your beast companion charges one creature other than the target.

Furious Fling.name: Furious Fling
Furious Fling.flavor: You lob your weapon at your foe, grievously injuring it.
Furious Fling.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Furious Fling.effect: Using your Hunter’s Quarry, you designate the target as your quarry.
Furious Fling.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage. If the target is your quarry, it takes ongoing 5 damage (save ends).

Invigorating Confrontation.name: Invigorating Confrontation
Invigorating Confrontation.flavor: Each strike you deliver against your quarry bolsters you.
Invigorating Confrontation.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Invigorating Confrontation.effect: Until the target is no longer your quarry, whenever you hit the target with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Marked for Death.name: Marked for Death
Marked for Death.flavor: A carefully aimed shot imperils your quarry.
Marked for Death.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Marked for Death.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier (melee) or 3[W] + Dexterity modifier (ranged) damage, and you mark the target until the end of your next turn. Until the end of the encounter, your Hunter’s Quarry deals two extra dice of Hunter’s Quarry damage against the target.

Shocking Assault.name: Shocking Assault
Shocking Assault.flavor: You rush your opponent, and before it can react, you pin the creature in place with steel.
Shocking Assault.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Shocking Assault.special: When charging, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Springback Shot.name: Springback Shot
Springback Shot.flavor: As an enemy rushes your position, you spring back suddenly and fire an arrow at it, discouraging it from approaching.
Springback Shot.trigger: An enemy moves during its turn to a square adjacent to you

Agile Escape.name: Agile Escape
Agile Escape.trigger: You are hit by an attack that makes you slowed, immobilized, restrained, or dazed
Agile Escape.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against the triggering attack.

Padfoot Advance.name: Padfoot Advance
Padfoot Advance.flavor: You glide over the ground like a stalking cat.
Padfoot Advance.effect: Until the end of your turn, you don’t take a penalty to Stealth checks for moving, and if you don’t hit with an attack while you are hidden, you remain hidden.

Resume the Hunt.name: Resume the Hunt
Resume the Hunt.flavor: You drop a foe and then sprint away in search of the next fight.
Resume the Hunt.trigger: You reduce an enemy to 0 hit points
Resume the Hunt.effect: You move your speed. You don’t provoke opportunity attacks for leaving a square at the start of this movement. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 bonus to all defenses.

Weathered Resilience.name: Weathered Resilience
Weathered Resilience.flavor: Each setback, stumble, or wound bolsters your determination to succeed.
Weathered Resilience.effect: Until the stance ends, you gain resistance to all damage equal to your Wisdom modifier while you are bloodied.

Answer with Steel.name: Answer with Steel
Answer with Steel.flavor: You instantly attack when an enemy comes too close. You then quickly step away.
Answer with Steel.trigger: An enemy moves during its turn to a square adjacent to you
Answer with Steel.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and you shift 1 square.

Quick Throw.name: Quick Throw
Quick Throw.flavor: You sling a weapon at a foe, catching the creature off guard.
Quick Throw.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Quick Throw.effect: Before the attack, you shift 1 square.
Quick Throw.target: One creature you have not attacked during this turn
Quick Throw.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you cannot attack the target again until the end of your turn.

Ravaging Tide.name: Ravaging Tide
Ravaging Tide.flavor: Your enraged beast lashes out at any enemies that are around it.
Ravaging Tide.onHit: 2[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage, and any enemy adjacent to your beast companion takes damage equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Thread the Needle.name: Thread the Needle
Thread the Needle.flavor: You take a shot and then dash toward your foe to engage it in melee.
Thread the Needle.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. You shift a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Thread the Needle.effect: If the target starts its next turn adjacent to you, you can make a melee basic attack against it as a free action.

Barreling the Fish.name: Barreling the Fish
Barreling the Fish.flavor: Your quick movement exposes your foe to a punishing attack. While the creature is recovering, you launch a weapon at a different enemy.
Barreling the Fish.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Barreling the Fish.effect: You shift 2 squares and make a ranged secondary attack. This attack doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
Barreling the Fish.attack: Strength vs. AC (melee). The attack can score a critical hit on a roll of 16–20.
Barreling the Fish.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Barreling the Fish.secondaryAttack: Strength vs. AC (thrown weapon). The attack can score a critical hit on a roll of 16–20.

Deadly Nightshade.name: Deadly Nightshade
Deadly Nightshade.flavor: You apply a dose of poison to your arrow or blade. When you strike, you temporarily debilitate your foe.
Deadly Nightshade.onHit: 2[W] + Strength (melee) or Dexterity (ranged) modifier damage. The target is weakened and takes ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends both).

Fearsome Beast.name: Fearsome Beast
Fearsome Beast.flavor: Your beast savages an enemy, making that creature its prey. When it grows bored, the beast launches itself at a new foe, drawing that creature’s attention.
Fearsome Beast.effect: Your beast companion gains 10 temporary hit points, and your beast companion marks the target until the end of the encounter or until your beast companion attacks a creature other than the target. Until the end of the encounter, whenever your beast companion makes an attack roll against any creature, it marks that creature until the end of the encounter or until it makes an attack roll against a different creature.

Overwhelming Confrontation.name: Overwhelming Confrontation
Overwhelming Confrontation.flavor: You strike your enemy from afar and leave it reeling. The best is yet to come, though.
Overwhelming Confrontation.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Overwhelming Confrontation.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Overwhelming Confrontation.effect: The next time you hit the target with a melee attack before the end of the encounter, the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.

Reactive Shot.name: Reactive Shot
Reactive Shot.flavor: You quickly fire at the first sign of combat.
Reactive Shot.effect: Using your Hunter’s Quarry, you designate the target as your quarry.
Reactive Shot.attack: Strength (thrown weapon) or Dexterity vs. AC
Reactive Shot.onHit: 3[W] + Strength (thrown weapon) or Dexterity modifier damage.

Trick Shot.name: Trick Shot
Trick Shot.flavor: You take several chaotic shots, which strike various parts of your foes’ bodies, inhibiting the creatures in different ways.
Trick Shot.effect:
Roll a d4 to determine the effect of each attack.
1—You knock the target prone.
2—The target is slowed (save ends).
3—The target is dazed (save ends).
4—The target is immobilized (save ends).

Blade and Bow.name: Blade and Bow
Blade and Bow.flavor: You switch between fighting in melee and at range, confusing your foe and leaving it vulnerable to both techniques.
Blade and Bow.effect: Until the stance ends, whenever you hit your quarry with a melee attack, your next ranged attack against your quarry before the end of the encounter deals extra damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. Whenever you hit your quarry with a ranged attack, your next melee attack against your quarry before the end of the encounter deals extra damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Ranger's Parry.name: Ranger's Parry
Ranger's Parry.flavor: You use your off-hand weapon to deflect an enemy attack.
Ranger's Parry.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Ranger's Parry.trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee or a ranged attack
Ranger's Parry.effect: You gain a +4 bonus to AC and Reflex against the attack, and you gain 10 temporary hit points.

Tree Runner.name: Tree Runner
Tree Runner.flavor: You’re accustomed to battling on precarious surfaces, and your sure footing lends you aid as you dart around the terrain.
Tree Runner.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you can move at full speed while climbing or balancing, or you can jump a distance up to your speed. You do not grant combat advantage while climbing or balancing, and you can jump down a number of squares equal to your speed without having to make an Acrobatics check to reduce falling damage.

Vengeful Oath.name: Vengeful Oath
Vengeful Oath.flavor: Seeing a foe wound one of your allies fills you with vigor and hardens your resolve against the offender.
Vengeful Oath.trigger: An enemy bloodies your ally or reduces your ally to 0 hit points or fewer
Vengeful Oath.effect: You can spend a healing surge and can make a saving throw against an effect that a save can end. Using your Hunter’s Quarry, you designate the triggering enemy as your quarry.

Duck and Draw.name: Duck and Draw
Duck and Draw.flavor: You duck beneath your enemy’s attack and then step away, striking at range.
Duck and Draw.trigger: An enemy makes a melee attack against you
Duck and Draw.effect: You shift a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Reproving Strike.name: Reproving Strike
Reproving Strike.flavor: Your attack brings vengeance to enemies that have hurt your friends.
Reproving Strike.attack: Strength (melee or thrown weapon) vs. AC
Reproving Strike.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage. If a bloodied ally is adjacent to the target, you push the target 1 square and knock it prone.

Suppressing Shots.name: Suppressing Shots
Suppressing Shots.flavor: You shower enemies with arrows, pinning them down. Any foes that try to move through the area you threaten will suffer the consequences.
Suppressing Shots.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Suppressing Shots.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you can make a ranged basic attack as an opportunity action against any enemy that moves into the area of the burst during its turn.

Wolverine Claw Strike.name: Wolverine Claw Strike
Wolverine Claw Strike.flavor: You dart among your foes in a low crouch, striking out on both sides.
Wolverine Claw Strike.effect: You shift 2 squares and make a secondary attack.
Wolverine Claw Strike.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Wolverine Claw Strike.secondaryeffect: You gain a bonus to AC equal to your Wisdom modifier until the end of your next turn.

Barbed Arrows.name: Barbed Arrows
Barbed Arrows.flavor: You loose a couple of shots at nearby enemies. When your opponents pull out the projectiles, chunks of flesh come with them.
Barbed Arrows.attack: Dexterity vs. AC. Make two attack rolls and use the higher result.
Barbed Arrows.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is weakened (save ends).
Barbed Arrows.aftereffect: The target takes ongoing 10 damage (save ends).

Crippling Spiral.name: Crippling Spiral
Crippling Spiral.flavor: Your arrow injures your enemy, knocking it to the ground or pinning it in place. Once your foe is hampered, your beast companion leaps into action.
Crippling Spiral.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Crippling Spiral.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends). In addition, the target loses its fly speed (save ends).
Crippling Spiral.onMiss: Half damage, and the target loses its fly speed until the end of its next turn.
Crippling Spiral.effect: Your beast companion shifts its speed and makes a secondary attack against the target.

Frantic Assault.name: Frantic Assault
Frantic Assault.flavor: Your shot marks the target you intend to kill. As you confront your foe in melee, your weapons flash in a whirlwind of steel, threatening other enemies as well.
Frantic Assault.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Frantic Assault.effect: Until the target is no longer your quarry, whenever you hit the target with a melee attack, any enemy adjacent to you takes damage equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Ringing the Bell.name: Ringing the Bell
Ringing the Bell.flavor: You come up behind your enemy and drive your weapon against its head, leaving it senseless.
Ringing the Bell.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and ongoing 5 damage (save ends). If you have combat advantage against the target, it is also dazed (save ends).

Unrestrained Aggression.name: Unrestrained Aggression
Unrestrained Aggression.flavor: Your volley of arrows rains down across your enemies. Among the targets, you pick out a single opponent to kill.
Unrestrained Aggression.effect: Using your Hunter’s Quarry, you designate one target you can see as your quarry.

Daunting Agility.name: Daunting Agility
Daunting Agility.flavor: You leap through the air with remarkable skill and speed.
Daunting Agility.prerequisite: You must be trained in Athletics.
Daunting Agility.effect: You shift your speed and have a +10 power bonus to Athletics checks to jump during the shift.

Fade from Sight.name: Fade from Sight
Fade from Sight.flavor: You step back and disappear amid the darkness or foliage.
Fade from Sight.effect: You shift 1 square. You can then make a Stealth check to become hidden if you have any cover or any concealment.

Fleet of Foot.name: Fleet of Foot
Fleet of Foot.flavor: You sprint through the battle with such speed that you’re already gone by the time your enemies swing.
Fleet of Foot.effect: Until the stance ends, you do not provoke opportunity attacks for moving. In addition, you don’t take a penalty to attack rolls or grant combat advantage for running.

Sharpen the Senses.name: Sharpen the Senses
Sharpen the Senses.flavor: You hone your senses and note the tiniest details around you.
Sharpen the Senses.effect: Until the stance ends, you gain a +5 power bonus to Perception checks. In addition, you can see invisible creatures unless they are invisible as a result of being hidden.

Tested Analysis.name: Tested Analysis
Tested Analysis.flavor: Each swing or shot instructs you on how best to anticipate your foe’s movement.
Tested Analysis.effect: Until the stance ends, whenever you miss your quarry with an attack, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against it until the end of your next turn.

Avalanche of Fury.name: Avalanche of Fury
Avalanche of Fury.flavor: You cut wide with your two weapons, and if the strategy doesn’t work, you save it for use later in the fight.
Avalanche of Fury.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Avalanche of Fury.effect: Make a secondary attack against the target.
Avalanche of Fury.secondaryOnMiss: You do not expend this power.

Flickering Blades.name: Flickering Blades
Flickering Blades.flavor: You whirl your weapon in a dazzling butterfly pattern. The flash of steel momentarily disorients any enemy you strike.
Flickering Blades.onHit: 3[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Ricochet Throw.name: Ricochet Throw
Ricochet Throw.flavor: As you unleash your weapon, it strikes one foe and then ricochets toward another, hitting that creature as well.
Ricochet Throw.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Ricochet Throw.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage. Make a secondary attack that uses the same thrown weapon you used for the primary attack.
Ricochet Throw.secondaryTarget: One creature within 5 squares of the primary target

Windwalk Strike.name: Windwalk Strike
Windwalk Strike.flavor: You glide across the ground as if you were the wind. Your swift movement catches your foes by surprise.
Windwalk Strike.effect: Before the attack, you shift your speed.
Windwalk Strike.attack: Dexterity vs. AC. The target grants combat advantage to you for this attack.

Wolf Howl Strike.name: Wolf Howl Strike
Wolf Howl Strike.flavor: You dart into sight and strike your foe as you howl.
Wolf Howl Strike.effect: Before the attack, you move your speed.
Wolf Howl Strike.attack: Strength (melee) or Dexterity (ranged) vs. AC. If the target couldn’t see you before you moved, it grants combat advantage to you for this attack.

Aid the Beast.name: Aid the Beast
Aid the Beast.flavor: You unleash a barrage of attacks from a distance, granting your beast the advantage.
Aid the Beast.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Aid the Beast.target: One creature adjacent to your beast companion
Aid the Beast.effect: Until the stance ends, you can make a ranged basic attack once per round as a minor action against one creature adjacent to your beast companion. If you hit the target, it grants combat advantage to your beast companion until the end of your turn.

Circling Cascade.name: Circling Cascade
Circling Cascade.flavor: You circle your opponent, striking hard. Your blows leave your enemy bruised, bloody, and reeling from the ferocious onslaught.
Circling Cascade.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Circling Cascade.effect: You shift 2 squares and make a secondary attack against the target. The target grants combat advantage to you for this attack.
Circling Cascade.secondaryOnHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage. If all three attacks hit the target, it is dazed (save ends).
Circling Cascade.secondaryeffect: You shift 2 squares and make a tertiary attack against the target. The target grants combat advantage to you for this attack.

Deadly Sidestep.name: Deadly Sidestep
Deadly Sidestep.flavor: When your enemy approaches, you deliver a single deadly thrust and then twist aside. You allow your foe’s momentum to send the creature tumbling.
Deadly Sidestep.trigger: An enemy moves during its turn to a square adjacent to you
Deadly Sidestep.onHit: 4[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Deadly Sidestep.effect: You slide the target a number of squares equal to 1 + your Wisdom modifier and knock it prone.

Incapacitating Confrontation.name: Incapacitating Confrontation
Incapacitating Confrontation.flavor: Your shot incapacitates an enemy, giving you the advantage in melee combat.
Incapacitating Confrontation.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Incapacitating Confrontation.effect: Until the target is no longer your quarry, whenever you hit it with a melee attack, the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.

Pulverizing Shot.name: Pulverizing Shot
Pulverizing Shot.flavor: You loose arrow after arrow at an approaching foe, piercing metal, flesh, and bone.
Pulverizing Shot.effect: Make the following attack four times against the target.
Pulverizing Shot.attack: Dexterity vs. Reflex. The attack can score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.

Rolling Fire.name: Rolling Fire
Rolling Fire.flavor: You sprint across the battlefield, dodging enemy attacks. When you stop, you unleash a pair of well-timed shots.
Rolling Fire.effect: Before the attack, you shift a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Rolling Fire.attack: Dexterity vs. AC. This attack doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

Skewering Shot.name: Skewering Shot
Skewering Shot.flavor: Your shot leaves an enemy with a gaping wound that oozes blood whenever the creature moves.
Skewering Shot.requirement: You must be wielding a thrown weapon.
Skewering Shot.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn. Until the immobilized condition ends, the target takes 15 damage whenever it teleports or is pulled, pushed, or slid.

Steel Breeze.name: Steel Breeze
Steel Breeze.flavor: You rush into the middle of your enemies and unleash a cyclone of steel that shocks your foes.
Steel Breeze.effect: Before the attack, you shift 3 squares.
Steel Breeze.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Two-Beast Strike.name: Two-Beast Strike
Two-Beast Strike.flavor: You strike at your foe, distracting it while your beast moves in for the kill.
Two-Beast Strike.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target grants combat advantage to your beast companion until the end of your next turn.
Two-Beast Strike.effect: Your beast makes a secondary attack against the target.
Two-Beast Strike.secondaryOnMiss: You do not expend this power.

Brutal Tempest.name: Brutal Tempest
Brutal Tempest.flavor: Your beast becomes a flurry of teeth and claws, rending flesh and breaking bone.

Culling Out.name: Culling Out
Culling Out.flavor: You hook your target with your weapon after you hit, and quickly drag it away from its allies.
Culling Out.effect: You shift a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier and pull the target adjacent to you.
Culling Out.special: When charging, you can use this power in place of a melee basic attack.

Gauntlet of Steel.name: Gauntlet of Steel
Gauntlet of Steel.flavor: You move effortlessly through ranks of enemies, cutting them down as you approach a target you have marked for death.
Gauntlet of Steel.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Gauntlet of Steel.effect: Before the attack, you shift your speed. During this movement, you can shift through enemies’ squares. Make a melee basic attack against each enemy whose space you enter. No enemy can be attacked more than once from a single use of this power.

True Arrow.name: True Arrow
True Arrow.flavor: The important arrow in your quiver is the one that finishes your foe.
True Arrow.onHit: 6[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. If you reduce the target to 0 hit points, this power is not expended.

Ultimate Confrontation.name: Ultimate Confrontation
Ultimate Confrontation.flavor: You study your foe’s movements, and as combat grows fiercer, your knowledge allows you to deliver deadlier blows with each hit.
Ultimate Confrontation.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Ultimate Confrontation.effect: Until the target is no longer your quarry, whenever you hit the target with a melee attack, you deal 1[W] extra damage. The extra damage increases by 1[W] each time you hit the target with a melee attack, up to a maximum of 5[W] extra damage. If you miss the target with a melee attack, the extra damage decreases to 1[W].

Warning Shot.name: Warning Shot
Warning Shot.onHit:
1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and choose 1 square in or adjacent to the primary target’s space. If a creature moves into that square before the start of your next turn, you can make a secondary attack against the new target as an immediate action.
Level 21: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
Warning Shot.trigger: A creature moves into the designated square.

Hindering Shot.name: Hindering Shot
Hindering Shot.flavor: An arrow in the leg slows even the hardiest creature.
Hindering Shot.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Guardian Arrow.name: Guardian Arrow
Guardian Arrow.flavor: You slam an arrow home and promise more if harm befalls your friend.
Guardian Arrow.effect: Choose an ally adjacent to the target. Until the end of the encounter, if the target attacks that ally, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against the target as an immediate interrupt. You cannot make this attack if the target is marked by that ally.

Archer's Stairway.name: Archer's Stairway
Archer's Stairway.flavor: A stairway of arrows appears where you point your bow.
Archer's Stairway.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Archer's Stairway.effect: Choose 5 contiguous squares of a vertical surface within your weapon range that you can see. The DC for climbing these squares is reduced by twice your Dexterity modifier until the end of the encounter.

Covering Volley.name: Covering Volley
Covering Volley.flavor: A series of arrows convinces your foes to take a different path.
Covering Volley.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Covering Volley.onHit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. A creature that moves into the area before the start of your next turn takes 5 damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Flying Steel.name: Flying Steel
Flying Steel.flavor: Your arrows force your opponent to take cover.
Flying Steel.effect: Until the end of the encounter, if the target ends its turn without cover from you, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against the target as an immediate reaction. This effect also ends if the target has cover from you at the end of any of your turns.

Arrow of the Savior.name: Arrow of the Savior
Arrow of the Savior.flavor: Your arrow saves a falling friend by pinning him or her to a nearby wall, or presenting a sudden handhold.
Arrow of the Savior.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Arrow of the Savior.trigger: A creature in range falls and has a wall or floor within 1 square of it
Arrow of the Savior.effect: The creature can attempt a saving throw to avoid falling farther. If successful, you can slide the creature 1 square to a horizontal surface, or to a vertical surface that the creature now climbs.

Pinning Shot.name: Pinning Shot
Pinning Shot.flavor: Your arrow passes through one enemy to pin another.
Pinning Shot.onHit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. The target and one enemy adjacent to the target are immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Thousand Arrow Awareness.name: Thousand Arrow Awareness
Thousand Arrow Awareness.flavor: You mark an area in your mind and feed arrows into it every time you have a spare moment.
Thousand Arrow Awareness.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Thousand Arrow Awareness.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when a creature moves into the area, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against that creature as an opportunity action. You can move the affected area up to 3 squares with a move action.

Defensive Volley.name: Defensive Volley
Defensive Volley.flavor: Your swift arrow weakens an enemy’s attack.
Defensive Volley.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Defensive Volley.trigger: An ally is hit by an attack
Defensive Volley.effect: You reduce the damage the target takes by your Dexterity modifier plus half your level.

Warding Shot.name: Warding Shot
Warding Shot.flavor: The first hit tells the enemy that you intend to make another if it makes a wrong move.
Warding Shot.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. If the target moves into a space adjacent to an ally before the start of your next turn, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against the target as an immediate reaction.

Tracking the Target.name: Tracking the Target
Tracking the Target.flavor: Your first target leads you to more.
Tracking the Target.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever the target moves adjacent to another enemy, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against that enemy as an immediate reaction.

Back on Target.name: Back on Target
Back on Target.flavor: Your arrow deflects an ally’s attack back onto its true course.
Back on Target.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Back on Target.trigger: An ally misses an enemy within range with a ranged attack.
Back on Target.effect: The target can reroll the attack with a +4 power bonus.

Entrapping Arrows.name: Entrapping Arrows
Entrapping Arrows.flavor: If your enemies move too far, you teach them why they shouldn’t.
Entrapping Arrows.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Entrapping Arrows.onHit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. If the target leaves the area of the burst before the start of your next turn, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against that enemy as a free action. If that attack hits, the target ends its movement.

Surprising Arrow Stance.name: Surprising Arrow Stance
Surprising Arrow Stance.flavor: Your arrows pin down everything you see.
Surprising Arrow Stance.effect: Until the stance ends, as an immediate reaction when an enemy within 5 squares of you moves, you can use the Surprising Arrow Attack power.
Surprising Arrow Stance.requirement: The power Surprising Arrow Stance must be active in order to use this power.
Surprising Arrow Stance.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target ends its movement.

Dangerous Friends.name: Dangerous Friends
Dangerous Friends.flavor: You let your foe’s friends know that proximity to the foe adds an element of danger.
Dangerous Friends.onHit: 3[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. When an enemy moves into a square within 2 squares of the target before the start of your next turn, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against that enemy as a free action.

Pinning Arrow Rain.name: Pinning Arrow Rain
Pinning Arrow Rain.flavor: A hail of your arrows traps your foes.
Pinning Arrow Rain.requirement: You must be wielding a bow or a crossbow.
Pinning Arrow Rain.attack: Dexterity vs. AC. Make two attack rolls.
Pinning Arrow Rain.onHit: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is immobilized on the first hit (save ends). If both attacks hit, add 2[W] to the damage dealt and the target is restrained instead of immobilized (save ends).

Interrupting Volley.name: Interrupting Volley
Interrupting Volley.flavor: The arrow is only the first in a barrage that hinders your enemy’s attacks.
Interrupting Volley.onHit: 3[W] + Dexterity modifier damage. If the target makes an attack before the start of your next turn, make the secondary attack as an immediate interrupt against it.
Interrupting Volley.secondaryOnHit: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target takes a penalty equal to your Wisdom modifier on the triggering attack roll.

Imprisoning Arrows.name: Imprisoning Arrows
Imprisoning Arrows.flavor: When your victim moves, you shut him down.
Imprisoning Arrows.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when the target willingly moves, you can make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against the target as an immediate interrupt. If that attack hits, the target ends its movement.

Harrying Hunter Stance.name: Harrying Hunter Stance
Harrying Hunter Stance.flavor: Through careful positioning and an instinctive connection, you and your companion mercilessly harry the foe.
Harrying Hunter Stance.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you and your beast companion gain combat advantage against any foe to whom you are both adjacent. If you and your companion are also flanking the target, you deal 2 extra damage on Hunter’s Quarry damage rolls against it.

Deceptive Steel.name: Deceptive Steel
Deceptive Steel.flavor: An off-hand attack your foe never saw coming causes disorientation as well as pain.
Deceptive Steel.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Deceptive Steel.trigger: You make an opportunity attack against an enemy.
Deceptive Steel.onHit: 2[W] (off-hand) + Strength modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, you also gain combat advantage and concealment against the target.

Murderous Aim.name: Murderous Aim
Murderous Aim.flavor: A moment’s careful study reveals to you a vast array of weak points to attack.
Murderous Aim.target: One creature designated as your quarry
Murderous Aim.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when you deal Hunter’s Quarry damage to this target, you can reroll any Hunter’s Quarry damage die result of 1 or 2 until it shows a value of 3 or higher.

Questing Blades.name: Questing Blades
Questing Blades.flavor: A vicious series of probes and strikes allows you to strike at your opponent’s greatest vulnerabilities.
Questing Blades.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Questing Blades.attack: Strength vs. the lowest of the target’s AC, Reflex, or Fortitude
Questing Blades.onHit: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is subject to your questing blades (save ends). While the target is subject to your questing blades, each time you attack the target with a power that normally targets AC, you instead attack the lowest of the target’s AC, Reflex, or Fortitude.
Questing Blades.onMiss: Half damage, and until the end of your next turn, each time you attack the target with a power that normally targets AC, you instead attack the lowest of the target’s AC, Reflex, or Fortitude.

Swooping Raptor.name: Swooping Raptor
Swooping Raptor.flavor: Deaths falls from above in the form of both arrow and talon.
Swooping Raptor.effect: Make a secondary attack against the target that is a melee beast 1.
Swooping Raptor.beast: If your beast companion is a bear, a raptor, or a wolf, the beast can charge in place of the secondary attack.

Fleet Hunter's Stance.name: Fleet Hunter's Stance
Fleet Hunter's Stance.flavor: You feel the flow of the earth beneath your feet, and it drives you onward and through your astonished foes.
Fleet Hunter's Stance.effect: Until the stance ends, whenever you use a ranger power that allows you to make multiple melee attacks, you can shift 1 square after each such successful attack.

Vengeful Fangs Stance.name: Vengeful Fangs Stance
Vengeful Fangs Stance.flavor: Your companion crouches, muscles tensed, ready to strike at all that threatens you.
Vengeful Fangs Stance.effect: Until the stance ends, your beast companion can score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20, and it gains a power bonus to damage rolls equal to your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier. As an opportunity action when an enemy hits you with an attack, you can command your beast companion to make a melee basic attack or a charge attack against that enemy. The beast does not provoke opportunity attacks if it charges during this action. Your beast companion gains combat advantage on this attack if the target is also your quarry.

Ferocious Insight.name: Ferocious Insight
Ferocious Insight.flavor: Your companion exudes an air of ferocity as it attacks, which lends agility and allows you both to react to your foe’s movements.
Ferocious Insight.onHit: 2[B] + your beast’s Strength modifier damage. If you and your beast companion are flanking the target, the first time the target moves or shifts before the end of your next turn, you and your beast companion can shift 3 squares as an immediate reaction.

Seismic Strike.name: Seismic Strike
Seismic Strike.flavor: You strike at your foe and your companion aids you in keeping the fools who oppose you within arm’s reach.
Seismic Strike.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can command your beast companion to use the Seismic Strike Attack power once per turn.
Seismic Strike.requirement: The power Seismic Strike must be active in order to use this power.

Beastly Protector.name: Beastly Protector
Beastly Protector.flavor: Your situation looks bleak, but your companion comes quickly to your rescue.
Beastly Protector.onHit: 2[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage, and you gain 10 temporary hit points.
Beastly Protector.effect: Until the end of the encounter, each time an enemy adjacent to your beast companion makes a melee attack against you, your beast companion deals damage equal to its Strength modifier to the attacker as a free action.

Shepherding Slice.name: Shepherding Slice
Shepherding Slice.flavor: In a flurry of movement, you send your enemies careening toward your beast companion, which is unlikely to let them escape.
Shepherding Slice.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can command your beast companion to make an opportunity attack as an opportunity action instead of an immediate interrupt. In addition, you can command your beast companion to use the Shepherding Slice Attack power once per turn until the end of the encounter.
Shepherding Slice.onMiss: Half damage, and slide the target 3 squares to a square adjacent to your beast companion.
Shepherding Slice.requirement: The power Shepherding Slice must be active in order to use this power.

Aligned Strike.name: Aligned Strike
Aligned Strike.flavor: You and your companion coordinate your strikes to land on two different foes.
Aligned Strike.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target

Lights Out.name: Lights Out
Lights Out.flavor: In a sudden move, you and your companion attack the eyes of your foes, making them easy prey.
Lights Out.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Lights Out.secondaryTarget: One creature other than the primary target
Lights Out.secondaryOnHit: 1[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage, and the target is blinded until the end of your next turn.

Fearsome Roar.name: Fearsome Roar
Fearsome Roar.flavor: Your beast companion bursts into thunderous roars of anger, shocking your foes and preventing their escape.
Fearsome Roar.onHit: 1[B] + beast’s Strength modifier damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Fearsome Roar.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Fearsome Roar.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can command your beast companion to use the Fearsome Roar Attack power.
Fearsome Roar.requirement: The power Fearsome Roar must be active in order to use this power.

Aimed Shot.name: Aimed Shot
Aimed Shot.flavor: Your mastery of the bow allows you to disregard cover, concealment, or some other hindrance.
Aimed Shot.effect: You make a ranged basic attack with a weapon, ignoring the penalty to attack rolls imposed by partial cover and partial concealment. In addition, the penalty to attack rolls imposed by superior cover and total concealment is no worse than -2 for this attack.

Clever Shot.name: Clever Shot
Clever Shot.flavor: By carefully judging your target’s stance, you unleash a shot that sends the enemy tumbling.
Clever Shot.effect:
You make a ranged basic attack with a weapon. If the attack hits, the target is also subject to one of the following effects of your choice:
    * You slide the target up to 2 squares.
    * The target falls prone.
    * The target is slowed (save ends).

Rapid Shot.name: Rapid Shot
Rapid Shot.flavor: You take careful aim at a group of enemies before unleashing a succession of arrows.
Rapid Shot.effect: You make a ranged basic attack with a weapon against each creature in or adjacent to a square within the attack’s range. You take a -2 penalty to the attack rolls.

Disruptive Shot.name: Disruptive Shot
Disruptive Shot.flavor: Through a combination of careful aim and perfect timing, your shot ruins your foe’s plans.
Disruptive Shot.onHit:
1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, and you choose for the target to be either immobilized (save ends) or dazed (save ends).
    Level 17: 2[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
    Level 27: 3[W] + Dexterity modifier damage.
Disruptive Shot.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Aspect of the Cunning Fox.name: Aspect of the Cunning Fox
Aspect of the Cunning Fox.flavor: Like a fox, you move with stealth, speed, and cunning. Your foes cannot hope to harm you while you are in motion, and you always keep an open escape route at hand.
Aspect of the Cunning Fox.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the cunning fox. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You take only half damage from attacks made against you during your turn.
    * Whenever you hit or miss with a melee attack or a ranged attack on your turn, you can take a free action to shift up to 2 squares.

Aspect of the Dancing Serpent.name: Aspect of the Dancing Serpent
Aspect of the Dancing Serpent.flavor: You move like a snake, darting here and there, never remaining within reach of your foe.
Aspect of the Dancing Serpent.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the dancing serpent. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You can take a free action at the end of each of your turns to shift 1 square.
    * When you make a basic attack against an enemy that has none of its allies adjacent to it, you gain a +1 power bonus to the attack roll and damage roll.
        Level 11: The bonus to the damage roll increases to +2.
        Level 21: The bonus to the damage roll increases to +3.

Aspect of the Pouncing Lynx.name: Aspect of the Pouncing Lynx
Aspect of the Pouncing Lynx.flavor: Like a hunting cat, you have learned to strike hard and fast.
Aspect of the Pouncing Lynx.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the pouncing lynx. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You gain a +4 power bonus to initiative checks.
    * During your first turn in an encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls.
    * You gain a power bonus to all defenses against opportunity attacks that you provoke by moving. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier.

Aspect of the Lone Wolf.name: Aspect of the Lone Wolf
Aspect of the Lone Wolf.flavor: Like the lone wolf, you learn to pick off the weakest of your enemies with quick and brutal efficiency.
Aspect of the Lone Wolf.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the lone wolf. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * When you make a basic attack against a bloodied enemy, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.
    * At the start of each of your turns, you learn the location of every hidden, bloodied enemy within 5 squares of you.

Aspect of the Lurking Spider.name: Aspect of the Lurking Spider
Aspect of the Lurking Spider.flavor: Like a spider, you lie in ambush and wait until your foe comes near before launching your attack.
Aspect of the Lurking Spider.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the lurking spider. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to Stealth checks.
    * You gain a +5 power bonus to Athletics checks made to climb.
    * While you have combat advantage against an enemy, you gain a +2 power bonus to damage rolls against it.
        Level 11: The bonus to damage rolls increases to +3.
        Level 21: The bonus to damage rolls increases to +4.

Aspect of the Regal Lion.name: Aspect of the Regal Lion
Aspect of the Regal Lion.flavor: You fight with the courage of a lion, taking on a larger foe without a sliver of doubt or fear.
Aspect of the Regal Lion.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the regal lion. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * When you make a basic attack against an enemy that is Large or larger, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against such enemies.

Aspect of the Seeking Falcon.name: Aspect of the Seeking Falcon
Aspect of the Seeking Falcon.flavor: You take on the aspect of the falcon, gaining its keen eyes and striking a fellowship with the primal winds, which carry your attacks ever farther.
Aspect of the Seeking Falcon.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the seeking falcon. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You ignore the penalty to attack rolls for making a ranged weapon attack at long range.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to speed.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to Perception checks.

Aspect of the Pack Wolf.name: Aspect of the Pack Wolf
Aspect of the Pack Wolf.flavor: You fight as a member of the pack, turning your allies’ positions to your advantage.
Aspect of the Pack Wolf.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the pack wolf. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You do not provoke opportunity attacks when leaving squares adjacent to your allies.
    * When you make a basic attack against an enemy adjacent to two or more of your allies, you gain a +1 power bonus to the attack roll. You also gain a power bonus to the damage roll against that enemy. The bonus equals the number of your allies adjacent to the enemy.
        Level 11: The bonus to damage rolls increases to 1 + the number of adjacent allies.
        Level 21: The bonus to damage rolls increases to 2 + the number of adjacent allies.

Bridge of Roots.name: Bridge of Roots
Bridge of Roots.flavor: The primal energy you draw from the ground calls forth a churning mass of great roots that can cover even the most dangerous ground.
Bridge of Roots.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. At least one square of the zone must be on a solid surface. You and your allies can ignore hindering terrain and difficult terrain in the zone. In addition, any portion of a pit, chasm, or similar feature within the zone becomes safe, passable ground.
Bridge of Roots.moveAction: You move the zone up to 5 squares, keeping at least one square on a solid surface.

Entangling Roots.name: Entangling Roots
Entangling Roots.flavor: Thick roots emerge from the ground in response to your command, and your foes stumble as they try to slip through them.
Entangling Roots.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. The ground in the zone is difficult terrain for your enemies. When any enemy charges, its movement cannot include any square of the ground in the zone.

Stalker's Mist.name: Stalker's Mist
Stalker's Mist.flavor: A thick fog settles over the area, blocking sight and muffling sound. Though the fog confounds other creatures, you can see through it with ease.
Stalker's Mist.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Squares in the zone are heavily obscured to your enemies.
Stalker's Mist.moveAction: You move the zone up to 5 squares.

Reactive Shift.name: Reactive Shift
Reactive Shift.flavor: You keep one eye on the fight around you at all times, so that you can slip away from an enemy that moves too close.
Reactive Shift.trigger: An enemy you can see ends its turn adjacent to you.
Reactive Shift.effect: You shift a number of squares up to your Wisdom modifier.

Healing Lore.name: Healing Lore
Healing Lore.flavor: The primal power you call upon allows access to the deepest reserves of strength.
Healing Lore.target: You or one ally in the burst
Healing Lore.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.

Thorn Ward.name: Thorn Ward
Thorn Ward.flavor: A shimmering tangle of briars appears before you. It seems harmless, but as a foe moves through it, the briars lash out like a living creature.
Thorn Ward.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Thorn Ward.moveAction: You move the zone up to 5 squares.

Eyes of the Owl.name: Eyes of the Owl
Eyes of the Owl.flavor: The spirits of the night grant you enhanced senses.
Eyes of the Owl.target: You and each ally in the burst
Eyes of the Owl.effect: Each target gains both darkvision and a +2 power bonus to Perception checks until the end of the encounter.

Hunter's Thorn Trap.name: Hunter's Thorn Trap
Hunter's Thorn Trap.flavor: Your primal magic forms invisible thorns that lurk just below the surface of the ground. When a foe steps on their location, they erupt to rend and tear flesh.
Hunter's Thorn Trap.effect: The target becomes a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter or until an enemy enters it. Without a Perception check (DC 10 + your level + your Wisdom modifier), your enemies notice neither the zone nor your use of this power. When an enemy enters the zone, the enemy takes 5 + your Wisdom modifier damage, and it is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Verdant Flames.name: Verdant Flames
Verdant Flames.flavor: Eldritch green flames wrap around your enemies, hampering their ability to defend themselves or hide from you.
Verdant Flames.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Enemies grant combat advantage and take a –5 penalty to Stealth checks while in the zone. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Verdant Flames.moveAction: You move the zone up to 5 squares.

Embrace the Wild.name: Embrace the Wild
Embrace the Wild.flavor: Faint images of the eagle, the owl, the wolf, and other hunting beasts flicker within your eyes as you take on those creatures’ extraordinary senses.
Embrace the Wild.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target has darkvision, cannot be blinded, never grants combat advantage, and can see all creatures within 10 squares of him or her.

Howling Winds.name: Howling Winds
Howling Winds.flavor: You call forth the primal spirits of wind and storm, sending them howling over the battlefield to harass your enemies.
Howling Winds.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you are surrounded by howling winds. Once on each of your turns, you can take a free action to slide an enemy within 10 squares of you a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Wall of Earth.name: Wall of Earth
Wall of Earth.flavor: The spirits of the earth respond to your bidding, forcing up a wall of densely packed soil and stone to rout your foes.
Wall of Earth.effect: You conjure a wall of earth that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall can be up to 2 squares high and must be on a solid surface. When you use this power, any creature in the wall slides to the nearest unoccupied space outside the wall, sliding the shortest distance possible. The creature then falls prone. The wall is blocking terrain and is immune to damage. When the wall ends, its area becomes difficult terrain until the end of the encounter.
Wall of Earth.sustainMinor: The wall persists until the end of your next turn.

Veil of Winter.name: Veil of Winter
Veil of Winter.flavor: An inky darkness falls over the area as you channel the primal essence of night and sunset.
Veil of Winter.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. The zone blocks line of sight for your enemies.
Veil of Winter.moveAction: You move the zone up to 5 squares.

Wrath of Root and Soil.name: Wrath of Root and Soil
Wrath of Root and Soil.flavor: Your senses are as those of the spirits of earth and air, tree and stone, and no foe can hide from you.
Wrath of Root and Soil.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. The ground in the zone is difficult terrain, and enemies cannot shift, teleport, or charge in or through it. An enemy that ends its turn on the ground in the zone is restrained (save ends).

Dual Weapon Attack.name: Dual Weapon Attack
Dual Weapon Attack.flavor: You follow your successful swing with a quick strike from your off hand.
Dual Weapon Attack.requirement: You must be wielding two melee weapons.
Dual Weapon Attack.trigger: You hit with a melee basic attack on your turn.
Dual Weapon Attack.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Aspect of the Charging Ram.name: Aspect of the Charging Ram
Aspect of the Charging Ram.flavor: You barrel past your foes with such speed and strength that they are unable to react to your assault.
Aspect of the Charging Ram.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the charging ram. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * Your movement during a charge doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
    * If you hit with a charge attack, you can knock the target prone.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to the damage rolls of charge attacks.

Aspect of the Hungry Shark.name: Aspect of the Hungry Shark
Aspect of the Hungry Shark.flavor: As you take on the aspect of the shark, the scent of blood drives you into a vicious frenzy.
Aspect of the Hungry Shark.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the hungry shark. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * When you make a basic attack against a bloodied enemy, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.
    * You can take a move action to shift up to 3 squares to a square adjacent to a bloodied enemy.
    * You gain a +5 power bonus to Athletics checks made to swim.

Aspect of the Soaring Hawk.name: Aspect of the Soaring Hawk
Aspect of the Soaring Hawk.flavor: You move through the battle like a hawk, carefully waiting for the best moment to strike, rising above all barriers that might restrict you.
Aspect of the Soaring Hawk.effect:
You assume a stance, the aspect of the soaring hawk. Until the stance ends, you gain the following benefits.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to speed.
    * You ignore the penalty to attack rolls imposed by partial cover and partial concealment, and you take no worse than a -2 penalty to attack rolls against targets that have superior cover or total concealment.
    * You gain a +2 power bonus to Perception checks.

Oak Skin.name: Oak Skin
Oak Skin.flavor: Your skin takes on the texture of tough bark, protecting you from the worst of your enemies’ attacks.
Oak Skin.effect: You gain resistance to all damage until the end of the encounter. The resistance equals your Wisdom modifier.

Ranger's Agility.name: Ranger's Agility
Ranger's Agility.flavor: The power of the primal spirits lets you move with the speed and subtlety of the wind.
Ranger's Agility.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to speed, and whenever you shift, the distance you can shift increases by 1 square.

Safe Passage.name: Safe Passage
Safe Passage.flavor: The spirits of earth, stone, and land accept your plea for assistance, allowing you and your allies to move unhindered and at great speed.
Safe Passage.target: You and each ally in the burst
Safe Passage.effect: Until the end of the encounter, each target ignores difficult terrain and gains a +2 power bonus to speed.

Step of Morning Mist.name: Step of Morning Mist
Step of Morning Mist.flavor: A magical mist wraps around you, letting you cross the battlefield in the blink of an eye, then clinging to you as a protective shroud.
Step of Morning Mist.effect: You teleport up to 5 squares, then gain a +5 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Root Gate.name: Root Gate
Root Gate.flavor: At your command, great roots threaded with primal power burrow through the ground around you, closing the space between two points on the battlefield.
Root Gate.effect: You create two zones, each one in an unoccupied square in the burst. The zones last until the end of the encounter. When you or any of your allies enters either of the zones, that character can teleport to the other zone as a free action, as long as the destination zone is unoccupied.

Iron Endurance.name: Iron Endurance
Iron Endurance.flavor: Your primal magic imbues you with a power as strong as any armor, granting you a surge of resilience in combat.
Iron Endurance.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value + 10.

Word of Warning.name: Word of Warning
Word of Warning.flavor: Acting solely on instinct, you evoke primal magic to lend your allies a surge of speed and combat awareness.
Word of Warning.trigger: You and your allies roll initiative.
Word of Warning.target: You and each ally in the burst
Word of Warning.effect: Each target gains a +5 power bonus to the initiative check and gains combat advantage until the end of his or her next turn.

Speed of the Zephyr.name: Speed of the Zephyr
Speed of the Zephyr.flavor: You move with the swiftness of the wind.
Speed of the Zephyr.effect: You gain a +6 power bonus to speed until the end of the encounter.

Stepping Through the Veil.name: Stepping Through the Veil
Stepping Through the Veil.flavor: As you step away from your enemy, you fade from its view, shielded by your primal magic as you prepare to strike again.
Stepping Through the Veil.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever you end your turn not adjacent to any enemies, you are invisible until the start of your next turn.

Avian Grace.name: Avian Grace
Avian Grace.flavor: You don’t know the secret of flight, but you have learned some lessons toward it.
Avian Grace.prerequisite: You must have a raptor beast companion
Avian Grace.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can make long jumps as if you had a running start, and you gain a +2 power bonus on your fly speed (if any).

Equestrian Maneuver.name: Equestrian Maneuver
Equestrian Maneuver.flavor: You guide your horse through tight spaces to reach that enemy who thought he was safe.
Equestrian Maneuver.prerequisite: You must have a horse beast companion
Equestrian Maneuver.effect: Until the end of your next turn, while you are mounted on your beast companion, squeezing does not cause you or your beast companion to take a -5 penalty on attack rolls, grant combat advantage, or move at half speed.

Feline Escape.name: Feline Escape
Feline Escape.flavor: You sidestep an attack as nimbly as your companion might.
Feline Escape.trigger: You are hit by an attack that targets AC or Reflex
Feline Escape.prerequisite: You must have a cat beast companion
Feline Escape.effect: You gain a +4 bonus to AC and Reflex until the end of your next turn. If the triggering attack misses you because of this bonus, you can shift a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

Path of the Monkey.name: Path of the Monkey
Path of the Monkey.flavor: You and your companion take to the trees as if born there.
Path of the Monkey.prerequisite: You must have a simian beast companion.
Path of the Monkey.effect: Until the end of the encounter or until your beast companion is killed or becomes unconscious, you gain a climb speed equal to your speed, and a +4 power bonus on Acrobatics checks.

Reptilian Perseverance.name: Reptilian Perseverance
Reptilian Perseverance.flavor: With the tenacity of the plodding giant lizard, you ignore those who would push you back.
Reptilian Perseverance.trigger: You or your beast companion are pushed, pulled, or slid.
Reptilian Perseverance.prerequisite: You must have a lizard beast companion
Reptilian Perseverance.effect: Reduce the triggering forced movement on you and your beast companion by a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

Slither's Stride.name: Slither's Stride
Slither's Stride.flavor: You twist, contort, and scramble with surprising grace and speed.
Slither's Stride.prerequisite: You must have a serpent beast companion.
Slither's Stride.effect: Until the end of the encounter or until your beast companion is killed or becomes unconscious, you can shift 2 squares as a move action and ignore difficult terrain when you shift. If you already ignore difficult terrain when shifting, you can shift 3 squares instead of 2.

Tenacity of the Tusked.name: Tenacity of the Tusked
Tenacity of the Tusked.flavor: You shake off a wound by channeling the savagery of the boar in combat.
Tenacity of the Tusked.trigger: You take damage from a melee attack.
Tenacity of the Tusked.prerequisite: You must have a boar beast companion.
Tenacity of the Tusked.effect: Reduce the damage you take from the triggering attack by a number equal to half your level + Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). If you take no damage from the attack because of this reduction, then you are not affected by any conditions or effects this attack would have caused on a hit.

Ursine Brutality.name: Ursine Brutality
Ursine Brutality.flavor: With a roar you lunge forward, bullying your enemies backward.
Ursine Brutality.prerequisite: You must have a bear beast companion.
Ursine Brutality.effect: Until the stance ends, when you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can push that creature 1 square.

Web Trick.name: Web Trick
Web Trick.flavor: Sticky webbing is a lifesaver in sticky situations.
Web Trick.prerequisite: You must have a spider beast companion
Web Trick.requirement: Your beast companion must be within 5 squares of you and able to make opportunity attacks.
Web Trick.trigger: You make an Athletics check while climbing or because you took damage while climbing, or you make a saving throw to avoid being forced into hindering terrain or over a precipice.
Web Trick.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to the triggering climb check or saving throw.

Wolf Trip.name: Wolf Trip
Wolf Trip.flavor: Once an enemy is on the ground, your wolf companion excels at keeping it there.
Wolf Trip.trigger: You take damage from a melee attack.
Wolf Trip.prerequisite: You must have a wolf beast companion
Wolf Trip.requirement: Your beast companion must be adjacent to the triggering enemy and able to make opportunity attacks.
Wolf Trip.effect: The triggering enemy is knocked prone and cannot stand up until it begins a move action not adjacent to your beast companion.

Blinding Assault.name: Blinding Assault
Blinding Assault.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Blinding Assault.flavor: Delivering a wicked strike, you momentarily rob your opponent of sight and then take advantage of its fumbling.
Blinding Assault.onHit: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage (melee) or 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage (ranged), and the target is blinded and cannot shift (save ends both). Until this effect ends, you can shift 1 square as a free action whenever the target misses with an attack.
Blinding Assault.onMiss: Half damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).

Rattle the Senses.name: Rattle the Senses
Rattle the Senses.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Rattle the Senses.flavor: A precise strike makes your enemy reel in disorientation, robbing it of its ability to use its specialized senses.
Rattle the Senses.onHit: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage (melee) or Dexterity modifier damage (ranged), and the target is dazed (save ends).
Rattle the Senses.effect: The target loses blindsight and tremorsense until the end of your next turn.
